poem:
Title: "Dreams Built with Stony Hearts"

In the heart of Scots' stormy eaves, a dream stirred,
Art like ivy, clung to the castle's stern gaze,
Edinburgh; a patient stage, silently endured.
Unfurled, humanity's call, in mist and haze.
Postwar petals bloomed in a spirit-care,
A festival born of need, for the shared vision's light,
The power of unity, resilient as the St. Giles's square.
